availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan Stamper Harlan (Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer and 1st lieutenant 5th Ky Cav (U.S.A.))

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Elijah Harlan and Margaret Harlan. Farmer in Monroe County in 1850. Wagonmaker in Monroe County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from March 31, 1862, to July 27, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 398A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 191.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 924.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 53.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #593,886, Certificate #405,534.
Find A Grave, "Jonathan Stamper Harlan (1830-1894)," Memorial #6445873, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6445873 (accessed November 12, 2020).
